column4: hey i'm looking for some advice. i have beryl installed and configured but i want to switch to the new compiz fusion. what's the best way to go about doing that?
don't. that's my advise
I switched over two days ago and it was nothing but buggy buggy buggy..
you will crash your desktop, guarantee. and also it leaves an update of 0B that never goes away no matter what. its a pain in the ass
wow. you sure you're not having an isolated case? i'm going to check the forums. what gfx card do you have?
I'm sure. you can have some fun trying it out, but I'm just lettin' you know.. I'll see you in here asking for help soon!
lol...
at the same time I was asking for help with that stuff there was two other people in there with the same problems...
what vid card u have? also, what did you end up doing?
built in intel video, and I ended up going back to beryl
it wasn't a video card issue because every now and again it would work, the PROGRAM was buggy, know what I mean
the only thing I noticed was it was much much harder to install and there wasn't much of any benefit except that cool burning writing. I would wait till it's developed a bit personally
yeh. is beryl in beta also? what i'm really interested in is the window switching effects, where you can line the whole cube out and drag programs from one screen to the next
I am doing that now with beryl...
any way to get those effect in beryl?
how do i get the new compiz fusion window switching effects in beryl? some kind of patch?
no man, compiz fusion is compiz and beryl
beryl is what does that effect
beryl is what does that effect...
open your beryl manager
right...
is it open?
check pm
what after the cube?
